title: [DO NOT MERGE] Playing with Travis
body_html:
As said, I wanted to quickly look into Travis' beta pipeline feature. It in short allows to group the build into stages that run sequentially. However, these stages can contain multiple job that run in parallel 🤓

Here I for instance grouped the linters:

☝️ note that build usually take about twice the time

Here I had steps with only one job each and the first one failing => the build already stops

All in all a nifty feature to speed up and have faster failing builds. Maybe also to have faster access to a stage or job's output. But it does not add more information into Github directly.

body: As said, I wanted to quickly look into Travis' [beta pipeline feature](https://blog.travis-ci.com/2017-05-11-introducing-build-stages). It in short allows to group the build into `stages` that run sequentially. However, these stages can contain multiple `job` that run in parallel 🤓 Here I for instance grouped the linters: ☝️ note that build usually take about twice the time Here I had steps with only one job each and the first one failing => the build already stops All in all a nifty feature to speed up and have faster failing builds. Maybe also to have faster access to a stage or job's output. But it does not add more information into Github directly.
